intro: Stachytarpheta chamissonis var. longipedicellata, commonly known as the long-pedicelled ironweed, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and showy, clustered inflorescences. The leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered with fine hairs, while the flowers are typically blue or purple. This variant is distinguished by its elongated pedicels, which give it its common name. It thrives in moist, sunny habitats and is often found in coastal areas and disturbed soils.
